comments.en:
Multi-function device: Printer, Scanner, Copier.

The printing engine seems to be the C82, so when your GIMP-Print version does not list this device explicitly as supported, pretend that you have the C82.

For scanning probably the following procedure which is known to work on the Epson Stylus CX3200 will work:

You need to do a small change in the "scanner.o" kernel module. See this posting on the linux-usb-devel mailing list and the thread "Epson Stylus cx3200 MFP" on the Epson Forum.

You have to remove the following from the drivers/usb/scanner.c file in the kernel source:

: 

    if (dev->config[0].bNumInterfaces != 1) {
        info("probe_scanner: Only one device interface is supported.");
        return NULL;
    }
Then you have to recompile, install, and reload the "scanner.o" Kernel module (assuming that the kernel source code is in the /usr/src/linux directory, the commands have to be executed as "root"):

    cd /usr/src/linux 
    make modules 
    cp drivers/usb/scanner.o /lib/modules/<Linux version>/kernel/drivers/usb/ 
    rmmod scanner 
    modprobe scanner vendor=0x04b8 product=<Product ID>
For "<Product ID>" you must insert the product ID of the scanner part of your CX5200. You can look it up in the /proc/bus/usb/devices file. Look for line containing something like "Vendor=03f0 ProdID=1e11 Rev= 1.00" which is located near the manufacturer and model name. Note that there are two entries for this device, one for the printing and one for the scanning part, so don't take the wrong one (you cannot damage anything, simply take the other one when the first one did not work).

After having done so you can configure SANE to use the CX5200 with the "epson" scanner driver, it is probably compatible to the Epson Perfection 1200U.

Copying should just work with the front panel of the device.
